attributes.action: Treat Government Residences as a taxable benefit
attributes.additional_details: To help reduce the deficit and in the interest of fairness to the rest of society, any residential property of the Government occupied by Ministers should be by treated as a taxable benefit, with the charge payable personally by the beneficiary (PM, Chancellor, Foreign Secretary, Deputy PM, N Ireland Secretary). Such properties to include 10-11 Downing Street, Chevening, Chequers, Dorneywood, Carton Terrace and Hillsborough Castle
